Description: Copper alloy statuette; form of the headdress identifies the figure as the goddess of Byblos, Astarte; headdress incorporates dove which has hole drilled through each wing; in her right hand she holds a garland and in her left a round object, perhaps an orange; she stands on a base which is a stepped apsidal podium on three feet; cast.
Bibliographic references: Fleischer R 1983a / Eine Gruppe syrisch-phönikischer Bronzestatuetten-Basen (pl.7c)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2022 19 May – 25 Sept, London, British Museum, Feminine Power 2014 5 Jun - 2 Nov, Waddesdon Manor, 'Predators and Prey: A Roman Mosaic from Lod, Israel' 26/11/2005 - 26/2/2006, "Egypt-Greece-Rome", Stadelsches Kunstinstitut und Stadtische Galeries, Frankfurt G88/NEW TESTAMENT/9 Syrian Room, case 13/4
Acquisition notes: Acquisition noted in the 'British Museum Quarterly' 32 (1967/68), p.58.
